00037 #ifndef LIB_SKELETON_H
00038 #define LIB_SKELETON_H
00039 
00040 //Stuff used in skeletons
00041 
00042 extern int _skeleton_dbg; //0=silent, 1=info, 2=debug
00043 
00044 #define emsg(a, args...) {fprintf(stderr,"Error in %s()[%s:%d] " a "\n", __func__, __FILE__, __LINE__, ## args); exit(-1); }
00045 #define dbg(a, args...)  { if(_skeleton_dbg>1) printf("DBG:" a "\n", ## args); }
00046 #define info(a, args...) { if(_skeleton_dbg)   printf(a "\n", ## args); }
00047 #define FREE(a)          { if(!a) emsg("Free on NULL pointer?"); free(a); a=NULL; }
00048 
00049 
00050 typedef enum {
00051   FC_WA_UNKNOWN             = -1,
00052   FC_WA_UNSPECIFIED         = 0,
00053 
00054   FC_WA_OCTANTS             = 1,
00055   FC_WA_MIN_DESCENDANTS     = 2,
00056   FC_WA_MIN_SEGMENT_LENGTHS = 3,
00057   FC_WA_MIN_ANGLE_CHANGE    = 4  
00058 
00059 } whittleAlgorithm_t;
00060 
00061 
00062 
00063 
00064 
00065 typedef struct {
00066   int       id_start;          //ID into element_centers of starting point
00067   int       id_stop;           //ID into element_centers of stopping point
00068   double    dist_center;       //Distance between element centers
00069   int       num_descendants;   //How many nodes are descended from this node
00070   int       num_ancestors;     //How many nodes are this guy's ancestors
00071 } spanning_tree_node_t;
00072 
00073 
00074 typedef struct {
00075   int                   root;
00076   int                   numNodes; //Excluding root
00077   spanning_tree_node_t *nodes;    //Excludes root
00078 
00079   //Basic info so we don't have to always look things up or recalculate
00080   FC_Mesh               mesh;
00081   int                   dim;
00082   int                   numElement;      //May be different than num_nodes if not fully connected
00083   int                   vertPerElement;  //laziness..
00084   double               *elementCenters;  //Initial values. DO NOT FREE, as many trees may share?
00085   int                   mesh_is_centers; //True when mesh's vertices represent the element
00086                                          //centers. This happens when it is saved to disk and
00087                                          //then reloaded.
00088 } spanning_tree_t;
